metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: To install R, go to https://cloud.r-project.org/ and download the latest version of R for Windows, Mac or Linux.
content.html: To install R, go to https://cloud.r-project.org/ and download the latest version of R for Windows, Mac or Linux.

content.text: When you have downloaded and installed R, you can run R on your computer.
content.html: When you have downloaded and installed R, you can run R on your computer.

content.text: The screenshot below shows how it may look like when you run R on a Windows PC:
content.html: The screenshot below shows how it may look like when you run R on a Windows PC:

content.text: If you type 5 + 5 , and press enter, you will see that R outputs 10 .
content.html: If you type 5 + 5, and press enter, you will see that R outputs 10.

content.text: When learning R at W3Schools.com, you can use our "Try it Yourself" tool, which shows both the code and the result in your browser. This will make it easier for you to test and understand every part as we move forward:
content.html: When learning R at W3Schools.com, you can use our "Try it Yourself" tool, which shows both the code and the result in your browser. This will make it easier for you to test and understand every part as we move forward:

content.code_html: 5 + 5
